Tags
A tag is a special label designed to classify System objects, determine the internal structure, and simplify the search.
To work with object tags, the user must have:
the
"View tags"
permission [VIEW_TAGS];
the "Read" permission for the "Tag Management" action [SYS_TAG_MANAGEMENT];
the "Write" permission for the corresponding object.
Tags are used when working with object types, object instances, subject areas, dashboards, Gantt charts, multidimensional cubes (OLAP) and their visuals, data sources, algorithms, and printed form templates.
To access the object tags, click the
button on the control panel, which opens the tag panel with the ability to edit the list of tags:
The tag panel is closed by clicking the
button on the right side of the panel.
To add new tags, click the
button, which opens a modal window with the tag registry (
more information about working with the registry
), where in
editing mode
new tags are created :
The System has pre-configured a set of tags associated with system objects to quickly search for objects that belong to the same module.
Sys. ETL;
Sys. Administration;
Sys. Audit;
Sys. Document flow;
Sys. Metadata;
Sys. NRI;
Sys. Printed forms;
Sys. Calculation module.
